TITLE: Almost half of the ultra-rich haven’t figured out how to pass on their wealth, research finds
SUMMARY: 41% of investors with more than $1 million worth of assets have not planned how they will pass on their wealth, a report by UBS found.

TITLE: Investors will be able to contribute up to $22,500 in 401(k) plans and $6,500 in IRAs in 2023
SUMMARY: The IRS has increased the 401(k) contribution limits to $22,500 and individual retirement account limits to $6,500 for 2023. Here's what investors need to know.

TITLE: Mark Cuban says this was always his ‘driving motivation’—and it’s not money
SUMMARY: Billionaire Mark Cuban said this week that he "never, ever thought in terms of money," even as he built the companies that made him exorbitantly wealthy.

TITLE: Here's how much you can earn and still pay 0% capital gains taxes in 2023
SUMMARY: The IRS has increased the taxable income thresholds for the 0%, 15% and 20% long-term capital gains brackets for 2023. Here's what investors need to know.

TITLE: This 37-year-old quit her job and now makes $10,000 a month in passive income: 'I wanted to be my own boss'
SUMMARY: After a layoff, Yo Quiero Dinero founder Jannese Torres was determined to be her own boss.  Today, she has 10 income streams that bring in $10,000 a month in passive income. Here's her best business advice.

TITLE: From fly fishing to cycling — the new popular pastimes of the ultra-rich
SUMMARY: While you might expect the ultra-rich to be all about golf, yachts and skiing, outdoor activities like fly fishing and mountain biking are becoming popular.

TITLE: MacKenzie Scott's latest $84.5 million donation could transform Girl Scouts as you know them
SUMMARY: Billionaire MacKenzie Scott recently donated $84.5 million to the Girl Scouts to hire staff, improve facilities and provide girls with STEM education.

TITLE: IRS bumps up estate-tax exclusion to $12.92 million for 2023. Here's what that means for wealthy Americans
SUMMARY: Starting in 2023, individuals can transfer up to $12.92 million to heirs, during life or at death, without triggering a federal estate tax bill.

TITLE: IRS: Here are the new income tax brackets for 2023
SUMMARY: The IRS has released higher federal tax brackets and standard deductions for 2023 to adjust for inflation. Here's what filers need to know.

TITLE: How to get the 'best of both worlds' for Series I bond interest rates before November
SUMMARY: With the interest rate for Series I bonds dropping to roughly 6.48% in November, you can still secure 9.62% for six months before the end of October.

TITLE: Rolls-Royce says it already has hundreds of U.S. orders for its $413,000 Spectre electric vehicle
SUMMARY: More than 300 buyers put down deposits for Rolls-Royce's first electric vehicle prior to its unveiling, the luxury automaker's CEO told CNBC.

TITLE: Asia-Pacific's travel industry could be the first to recover by 2023
SUMMARY: Asia-Pacific may have had a slow start, but travel recovery in the region is rapidly underway, according to a report by The World Travel & Tourism Council.

TITLE: Star witness who visited Elizabeth Holmes after fraud trial says 'she needs to pay her debt to society'
SUMMARY: "I don't want to help Ms. Holmes, she's not someone who should be helped," said former Theranos lab director Adam Rosendorff.

TITLE: The student debt forgiveness application is live online: Here's how to apply
SUMMARY: The Dept. of Ed is officially accepting applications for student debt forgiveness via a web portal. The beta launch began this past Friday.

TITLE: Strategies to navigate the $68 trillion 'great wealth transfer,' according to top-ranked advisors
SUMMARY: Here are four key considerations to help prepare for the biggest wealth transfer ever, according to CNBC's top-ranked financial advisors.

TITLE: Series I bond interest expected to fall to roughly 6.48% in November. But that's still a 'really good rate,' experts say
SUMMARY: Series I bonds, an inflation-protected and nearly risk-free investment, may reduce annual rates to roughly 6.48% in November, experts say.

TITLE: 'The best buying opportunity': Why now is a good time to invest, according to a stock market historian
SUMMARY: The market's performance so far in 2022 has been rough. But the situation may be about to turn around, says the publisher of "The Stock Trader's Almanac."

TITLE: Mark Cuban became a millionaire at age 32—here's why he chose against retiring early
SUMMARY: At age 25, Mark Cuban wanted to get rich and retire within a decade. He achieved the first part — but here's why he's still working, nearly 40 years later.

TITLE: Young, wealthy investors are flocking to alternative investments, study shows. What to know before adding to your portfolio
SUMMARY: Many younger, wealthy investors are looking beyond the stock market for above-average returns, with 80% turning to alternative investments.

TITLE: Powerball's jackpot is now $420 million and Mega Millions' top prize is $494 million. Here's how to handle a huge windfall
SUMMARY: If you beat the odds stacked against hitting the jackpot, there are some key things to do — and not do — right out of the gate.

TITLE: 39-year-old millionaire shares why he 'regrets' paying off his 2 home mortgages: 'I felt trapped'
SUMMARY: Graham Cochrane was living off food stamps before he built a million-dollar business. He paid off two mortgages and was debt-free by age 35. But just a year later, he regretted his decision. Here's what he would have done differently—and his advice for homebuyers.

TITLE: Free weekly credit reports are available through the end of 2023. Why you may want to check yours now
SUMMARY: Free weekly credit reports are now available from the three major credit bureaus through the end of 2023. Here's how that can help boost your credit score.

TITLE: Mark Cuban credits his first tech job to this interview strategy: I answered a trick question honestly
SUMMARY: Dallas Mavericks owner Mark Cuban says he landed his first job in tech by answering a trick question honestly. The foot in the door led to a lucrative career.

TITLE: These are common (and costly) Roth IRA conversion mistakes. Here's how to avoid them
SUMMARY: While Roth individual retirement account conversions may be alluring when the stock market dips, it's easy to make mistakes, financial experts say.

TITLE: Jamie Dimon says Musk should 'clean up Twitter,' echoes Tesla CEO's bot concerns
SUMMARY: Jamie Dimon appears to be a fan of Elon Musk's $44 billion Twitter takeover deal.

TITLE: Airlines are adding more flights in Asia. Here's how that may affect airfares
SUMMARY: Recent announcements from major airlines show that commercial aviation continues to rebound in the region. But it may take some time before airfares fall.

TITLE: Here's how uber-rich pass wealth to heirs tax-free when markets are down
SUMMARY: Wealthy people like Michael Bloomberg and Mark Zuckerberg have used grantor-retained annuity trusts. The trusts have better odds of success in down markets.

TITLE: IRS delays guidelines, waiving penalties for some inherited retirement accounts until 2023
SUMMARY: If you inherited a retirement account in 2020 or 2021, the IRS is waiving penalties for some heirs who needed to start taking required minimum distributions.

TITLE: Shaquille O’Neal reveals Jeff Bezos's investing principle that he still uses today
SUMMARY: Former NBA basketball player Shaquille O'Neal shared an investment principle he heard from Amazon founder Jeff Bezos, which has inspired his undertakings since.

TITLE: I spent 5 years interviewing 233 millionaires—here are the 6 habits that made them ultra wealthy
SUMMARY: What separates the ultra rich and successful from everyone else? Financial expert Tom Corley spent five years interviewing 233 millionaires to find out the habits they had in common.
